thread.title: Yellowstone visitor centre at Mammoth reopening after renovations that lasted nearly 2 years
thread.title_full: Yellowstone visitor centre at Mammoth reopening after renovations that lasted nearly 2 years - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Associated Press
title: Yellowstone visitor centre at Mammoth reopening after renovations that lasted nearly 2 years
text:
YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo. - The National Park Service is celebrating the reopening of the Albright Visitor Center at Yellowstone National Park.
The centre in Mammoth Hot Springs was closed in the fall of 2013 to allow construction crews to retrofit the building to better withstand earthquakes and to make it more accessible. The grand reopening is scheduled for Sunday.
The centre was originally built as bachelor officer's quarters by the U.S. Army in 1909 and served a variety of purposes before being made into a visitor centre.
Exhibits and displays inside the centre also received a makeover.
